(to the guard) Dont sweat it, Ive got this section covered. Yeah, in fact Ive got this little baby (Turns on a mini-flashlight) to shine in peoples eye(The guard walks away)Okay, see you later.
I just wanted to show Monica your book. (Ross just glares at him.)
(entering) Hey everybody! Happy Thanksgiving!
No, no, no. No-no-no.
What, are we keeping Thanksgiving a secret this year?
No, we're playing this game I learned at work. You have to name all the states in six minutes.
What? That's like insanely easy!
Now, that's a lot harder than it sounds. You always forget at least one, or in some cases... fourteen (looks over to Monica).
It's a stupid game and I wasn't playing against other people, so technically I didn't lose.
What? You forgot fourteen states?
Nobody cares about the Dakotas. (Thats true in so many ways, trust me, Ive lived in one and been to the other.)
Oh, okay, time's up!
All right, I got 48.
Oh that's not bad, Pheebs?
Oh, I got tired of naming states. So I decided to list the types of celery, and I have one: regular celery.
Okay, so Rachel's got 48 and Phoebe has the lead invegetables, Joey?
Say hello to the new champ of Chandler's dumb states game.
Wow, how many have you got?
Fifty-six!
Hey! How is New England not a state? Huh? They have a sports-team!
Does South Oregon have a sports-team? (Joey strikes one from his list) There you go.
(counting the place settings) How come we have one extra place setting?
'Cause you invited your assistant.
Oh, right. Sorry. But Tag's not coming; his girlfriend came into town, so he's spending Thanksgiving with her.
Oh! Why didn't you tell me? I made him his own individual sweet potato stuffed pumpkin.
Well, I was going to, but then I figured, you know... you're food is so delicious and perfect, you can never have too many of those pumpkin things.
Now you think I wouldn't enjoy that, because it is so fake, (Laughs) but I still do.
Regular Celery! (Starts to write that on her list) Oh, I already have that. (She gets up and heads for her room)
Done! With time a-to-spare.
Oooh that may be a New World's record (Looks at his watch and picks up Ross' pad)

You know, I hate to lecture you guys, but it's kinda disgraceful, that a group of well-educated adults and Joey can't name all the states. Did you ever see a map, or one of those round, colorful things called "a globe?" Hmm?
Uh, Magellan? You got 46 states. (Smiles and hands Ross back his pad)
What? That's impossible.
46. Wow! Who's well educated now, Mr. I-forgot-ten-states?
All right, I'm out of oven space. I'm gonna turn on Joey's. Please, watch him! Do not let Joey eat any of the food!
I am only one man! (Monica heads out) Okay Ross, time is up!
No, just give me another minute.
Look Ross, if you don't know them by now, you will never know them, okay? That is the beauty of this game. It makes you want to kill yourself.
This-this is crazy! I can do this! All right, uhh, I bet I can get all 50 before dinner.
Okay, but if you can'tno dinner!
You're on!
(gets up) All right. Don't look at my list, Ross, 'cause there's a lot on there that you don't have.
(entering, to Joey and Rachel) Hey, did you guys know, that your oven doesn't work?
But the drawer full of take-out menus is okay, right?
Ross, I'm gonna use yours, okay?
Pshhshhh!
Chandler? Can you give me a hand? (Grabs her jacket)
Sure, and Joey; do not let Ross look at any of the maps or the globe in your apartment.
Don't worry, Chandler, it's not a globe of the United States.
Hey you guys I'm gonna go out and take a walk.
Phoebe, why is your bag moving?
Oh, it's not!
Seriously, it's moving!
What the hell is in there?
It's just my knitting that's all! (A dog sticks its head out of Phoebe's bag. Everyone looks puzzled.) Yes! I knit this. I'm very good.
Rosss apartment is nice! How come we don't hang out here more often?
I don't know. Maybe it's because it smells a little weird. It's like old pumpkins or something.
That's my pie!
Which smells delicious!
Uh-oh! Uh-oh!
What?
We left Joey alone with the food! (Walks towards the window and looks out) Yep! Yep, I knew it! There he is... feeding stuffing to a dog!
(answering the phone) Hi Geller-Bing residence. How can I help?
Phoebe, why is there a dog in our apartment?
I'm sorry, who's this?
Phoebe, there's a dog sitting on my couch!
Tell her, I'm allergic, and I will sue!
No, there's no dog here?
Yes there is! He's black and white and shaggy and [Cut to Monicas apartment] he's sitting next to Rachel and licking Rachel's hand.
Oh my god! Where are you? (Looks around.)
I'll be right there!
(Phoebe hangs up and someone knocks on the door. She gasps.) They're here already? How are they doing this?
(gets up and opens the door) Hi Tag! What are you doing here?
I, uh, wanted to see if your offer to spend Thanksgiving with you is still good.
Well, sure! Come in! (He enters) Well, what-what happened to your girlfriend?
We kinda broke up this morning.
Oh, I'm sorry.
Yeah, so she went back to Ohio.
Ohio!! Thank you!
Huh! Where is the dog?!
What dog? There-there's no dog here.
Yeah that dog left!
(walks to Phoebe's door) Phoebe! Phoebe, open up!
There's no dog in here.
Phoebe, we can hear the dog barking!
No that's just me coughing! (Doing some weird coughing noises and the dog barks again. Phoebe comes out of the room.) Oh, good, there you are! Listen, um, I have a dog in my room.
What is it doing here?

Well, I'm watching it for some friends who went out of town. Wait. (She bends down, picks up the dog, and waves with one of its paws) Hello, my name is Clunkers. May I please stay with you nice people?
Oooh, I wish she could stay here, but Chandler is allergic!
Extremely allergic, okay? If I'm anywhere near a dog for more than 5 minutes, my throat will just close up!
That's odd, 'cause this dog's been living here for the past 3 days
(gasping) Really?
Chandler, if that dog's been here that long, and you haven't had a reaction, maybe you're not allergic to this dog?
Well, it still has to go, right?
Okay, it's um
(interrupting him) Don't do it!
Don't do what?
(to Joey) I have to! Okay? It's time! (Joey shrugs as if to say, "Do what you have to do") Okay, I hate dogs.
What?
Are you crazy?
Are you out of your mind?
Why?
Told ya. (Waves bye-bye.)
They are needy, they are jumpy, and you can't tell what they are thinking, and that scares me a little bit.
Right, they are scary. (He jumps up, screaming) Ahh, she just ate a treat out of my hand!!!
Wait a minute. Do you not like all dogs? I mean, not even puppies?
(scared) Is there a puppy here?
You don't like puppies?
(to Tag) Okay, you are new!
Look, Chandler, I told you, never tell anyone about this dog thing. It's like Ross not likin ice cream.
You don't like ice cream?
It's too cold.
Okay, it's just that dogs make me a little uncomfortable.
(to Phoebe) It hurts my teeth.
And I don't wanna say this, I don't you guys to hate me, but uh, I don't think, I can be around that dog anymore. Okay, so either the dog goes, or I go. (An awkward silence ensues.) Oh my god!!
How can I not get this? I'm a college professor; I got 1450 on my S.A.T.s.
Damn, I forgot you were here.
All right. We're gonna take Clunkers to Rosss. We'll be back in a minute. (Gets up with Monica to do so.)
Oh, wait before you guys go, can I just ask you a question?
Yeah.
When a guy breaks up with his girlfriend, what is an appropriate amount of time to wait before you make a move?
Oh, I'd say about a month.
Really? I'd say 3 to 4.
Half hour. (Rachel turns to look at him and he nods yes.)
Interesting.
When it's your assistant, I would say never.
All right, Rach, the big question is, does he like you? All right? Because if he doesn't like you, this is all a moo-point.
Huh. A moo-point?
Yeah, it's like a cow's opinion. It just doesn't matter. It's moo.
(to Monica and Phoebe) Have I been living with him for too long, or did that all just make sense?

Please, don't listen to Joey, okay. Would you look at him? He-hes obviously depressed. He's away from his family; he's spending Thanksgiving with strangers. What he needs right now is for you to be his friend.
You're right, I'm sorry. Thank you. Okay, that's what I'm gonna do.
Fine! Take their advice. No one ever listens to me. When the package is this pretty, no one cares what's inside.
Hey!
Hey.
How are you holding up?
Not bad.
Yeah? I'm sorry about your girlfriend.
Thanks.
So were you guys together a long time?
A year. On and off. I kinda thought we'd end up together. I don't anymore.
Now that she broke up with you?
Yeah.
Yeah. Hmmmm.
It's weird. I always used to assume, that I would meet someone and fall in love and be happy and all that was just a given. But lately it's like what if it's not. Do you ever have that feeling?
NoYeah, all the time, constantly. It's terrifying. But you know that I figure itit has to work out.
Why?
Because, uhit has to.
You have all the answers, don't you?
Yeah, I know, I do. I really do.
Hey, thanks for talking to me.
Well, what is a boss for? Hug it out! (They hug)
(through the window) All right, he likes you back! Huh? Told ya, you should go for it!
What?
(realizes what he said) Street noise drowned any of that out? (Rachel moves madly towards him) No, all right, I see you later, okay... (Turns away embarrassed)
What did Joey say? I like you back?
Uh, yeah, well, see, he Joey knows, that I'm-I'm very insecure about my back and, andyou're hugging me, so obviously you are not repulsed by it, yeah!
Wait-wait a minute; that doesn't make any sense.
No? (He shakes his head) All right, here's the truth um, Joey said what he said, because um, I'm attracted to you.
Wow. (He starts to walk towards the railing.)

Yeah, I admit it. I have a crush on you, and uh, and, and I know that's crazy because we work together, and-and nothing could ever happen, and the last thing I want to do is-is to freak you out or make you feel uncomfortable. Which is why it would be really great if you said something right about now.
(looking at the street) Oh my god! Those guys are stealing my car! (He points down to the street)
What?
Right there! That's my car! (Sound of a breaking car-window) Hey!!
Okay, that's gonna take them a minute. Do you have anything else you wanna get off your chest?
I can't believe this! (He walks back in again)
(she hurries after him) Wait, we still have time to talk and theyre-they're not even in the car yet! (She takes a quick look down the street.) Oh look, there they go, okay. (She hurries in, too)
Okay Phoebe, we should probably go back now.
(doing Clunkers) Please don't leave me, I'll be lonely.
Stop it. Stop! Okay let's go. We can be strong.
Yeah, okay.
Oh my god! Did you hear that? She said Monica! (She goes back to Clunkers again) Oooh, I can't leave her!
You know if you want, we can sneak the dog back in and Chandler wouldn't even know.
That's not gonna work.
I've had that dog there for three days and Chandler had no idea. He's not so smart.
Hey! I didn't know either.
Yeah, but you kinda knew that something was going on, didn't you?
Yeah, I knew.
Where's Chandler?
(comes out of the bathroom) Here I am.
Wash your hands!!!
How did youknow? (Heads back into the bathroom)
Hey! What's she doing back here?
Relax, Ross. She's not made of ice cream!
Hey look, Phoebe. I, uh, I laid out the states geographically...
(interrupts him) No, no, we don't really have time for this right now. Okay, we have to keep Chandler away from my bedroom.
Yeah, but, but look what I'm...
See, this is exactly what we do not have time for. (She rushes into her room)
(comes out of the bathroom) Where's Monica?
Um, in Phoebe's room. You can't go in there.
Why not?
Monica's crying. She's very upset about this whole Clunkers thing.
Well, I, I should go in there.
No. No, no. She doesn't want to see you right now.
Why not?
Because you sent away the dog!
This is ridiculous. (He heads for Phoebe's bedroom)

Oh, is it? Is it? Look, when Monica and I were kids, we had a dog named Rover. And, uh, one day, my dad decides, he doesn't like dogs. So Monica and her friendPhyllistake away the dog. And that was the last time we ever saw him. Don't you see? This is just like that. Only with a few details changed.
(entering) Okay, I'm in my sweat pants. Bring on the food! (Sees that Chandler has a worried look on his face) What's the matter?
Monica's all upset, because I sent Clunkers away.
So? Bring the dog back, you're a hero.
Yeah, I can be a hero, I could do that. I could, I could do... I, w-w-what if, what if it attacks me?
Chandler, it's like a big gerbil.
And that doesn't scare you? (He walks out)
Ross, you need some help?
From you? (He does a weird desperate laughter, like he's almost crying) Yes, please!
(sits down next to Ross) First of all, Utah? Dude, you can't just make stuff up!
I hate America! When I finish this game, I swear I am moving.
Hey! Tag's still talking to the police.
Yeah, ohh! Why, damnit, why did I open my mouth? (In a girlish voice) I have a crush on you; I am attracted to you. (Back to normal again) Gee, I-I know that I freaked him out
If you said it like that, you probably did, yeah.
(opens her bedroom door and peeks out) Hey, is Chandler here?
No, no he went for a walk.
Okay, but you cannot tell him... but look whose back!
(gasps) Hi!
Oh No-no-no-no-no-no-no! He went over to Ross' to bring the dog back here!
Oh no, the dog's not going to be there!
You think?
Hi, honey.
Please, please, please, don't be mad at me.
What? Why, why would...
(interrupts her, to Monica) Shh, wait and see. Maybe we will, maybe we won't.

Okay, I went over to Ross' apartment to bring back Clunkers. Yknow, for you, and(Clears his throat) I left the door open and she must have gotten out and I looked everywhere, all over the apartment, including the roof, which FYI Ross, one of your neighbors, growing weed. I couldn't find him, and I am so, so, so, sorry. But I do know where we could all go ease the pain. (Points up and then over to the street)
We have good news, look whose back!
(uncovers the dog) Hi!
Clunkers?! Oh my god!
That's right, she came back all by herself.
It's a Thanksgiving miracle!
(to Clunkers) It is so good to see you!

Yeah, she came all the way back from Ross' building. Oh, the things she must have seen! And then she climbed up the fire escape and she tapped on the window with her teeny little paw and then we ran to let her in(Realizes, that Chandler starts to not believing her) I went to far, didn't I? When should I have stopped?
Okay, maybe this is so hard, because there aren't 50 states. Let me tell you something, I have 49 states, and there are no more! I-I think, I should be able to eat something.
It's up to you.
Oh, hi! How are you doing?
I'm okay. I gotta go down to the police station and look at mug shots.
Oh.
Thanks for having me over, you guys.
Tag? Y-You're going? (Comes over to Tag) Uh we didn't, uh we didn't get the chance to talk. Uh, so, where did you say you're from again?
Colorado.
Ah, what good are you. (Walks back to his map dejectedly.)
Look, um, I think we should talk about what happened on the terrace.
Okay.

Ah, I-I never should have said what I said. Ityknow what? It just doesn't matter how I feel. I mean we work together, so nothing could really ever happen between us, and what I would love is just to go to work on Monday, and-and never talk about this again, okay? Big day Monday lots to do. So, we're okay?
Um, I'm not.
Oh, god, I know it, that I freaked you out.
No, you didn't. The only thing that freaked me out was you saying that nothing could ever happen between us.
Really?
Yeah, so, please don't fire me for doing this. (He kisses her)
Okay, well, that's one less thing we have to do on Monday.
Delaware! (Starting to cry.) Delaware!
All right.
(hands Chandler his pad and walks in) I want my turkey now!
You got it. (Starts looking at the pad, while Ross got the turkey out of the fridge and starts to unwrap and it) You got Nevada twice.
(pauses) I know.
Yeah. (Throws the pad on the table and heads for the bedroom)
(on the bike) Im ready!
You sure?
Uh-huh!
Okay, let me just straighten out your helmet there. (Does so.)
(To Chandler) Thanks daddy.
No-no, one daddy, two mommies. All right, its all yours. (Ross pushes him off.)
Okay. Okay.
Yes! Yes! Yes!! (Everyone stands and claps.)
His first big kids bike, this is so exciting!
Oh yeah, I remember mine! Ohh, it was my sixth birthday, my dad took me to the park, I got it, andit bent.
Yeah.
I never had a bike of my own.
(shocked) What?!

Well, we didnt have a lot of money. But the girl across the street had the best bike! It was pink and it had rainbow colored tassels hanging off the handle grips, and-and-and a bell and this big, white wicker basket with those plastic daisies stuck on.
That sounds like my first bike. (They all turn and look at him.) My dad gave me his old one.
Ohh.
Did the girl ever let you ride it?
No! But she gave me the box that it came in. It had a picture of the bike on the front. (Theyre all speechless) So I would sit on it and my step-dad would drag me around the backyard.
That is so unfair!
Not really, I got to drag him around too! (They all nod, "Oh.")
Hey! What are you guys doing?
Hey.
Making holiday candy for the neighbors.
Im sorry, who?
Im gonna hang this basket (Points to the one sitting on the table) on the door and when the neighbors walk by they can all take a piece.
But we dont know the neighbors.
I do. Theres uh, lets see, Guy With a Mustache, Smokes-A-Lot Lady, Some Kids Ive Seen, and A Red-haired Guy Who Does Not Like To Be Called Rusty.
See? This is exactly why Im making this candy. We can learn their names and get to know our neighbors.
Wouldnt it be easier if we just moved?
(entering, happily) Gooood morning!!
Eh, somebodys in a good mood!
Well, why shouldnt I be? I have great friends! I have a wonderful job!
Where you can make out with your assistant.
Come on, its not a big deal! We stayed up all night coming up with a plan so that us dating will not be a problem.
Oh yeah, whats the plan?
(pauses as she thinks and exhales loudly) We We are not going to let it be a problem.
Wow! It took you all night to come up with that plan?!
Well yknow, we did other stuff too. (Joey and Chandler start to giggle.)
Did you two
Oh Monica come on, yknow I dont sleep with guys on the first date!
Matt Guire, Mark Lynn, Ben Wire
Anymore!!
Okay.
Hi. Tag, I have a conference call today is that correct?
Yes, at 4:00.

Okay, thank you. Thatll be all. (The mail guy leaves and Tag starts to follow, but Rachel stops him.) (Excitedly) Wait! Wait! (Rushes over and closes the office-door.) Did you see that? That mail guy had no idea there was something going on between us. (They kiss.)
Id better get back to my desk.
Okay, you hard worker! Ill remember to put that in your evaluation.
My what?

Well, youve been here for two months now and your boss is required to hand in a performance evaluation. But yknow, there is one thing that I have yet to evaluate. (She turns around and sweeps the stuff off of her desk and hops up onto it.)
Are you serious?
No, Ive just always wanted to do that. Can you help me clean this up?
The basket is totally empty! My God, the neighbors ate all the candy!
Well, either that or uh(Motions towards Joeys door.)
Joey!!
Yeah?
Did you eat all the neighbor candy?!
Uh well yeah, that was the plan, but by the time I got to it there was only a couple of pieces left!
Yeah, and theyve been coming by all day. They love it!
They love my candy? Oh man!!! Ive gotta go make more!! (Starts to do so.)
Hey Mon, you might wanna make some more lasagna too, because something mightve happened to a huge chunk of it.
Ross! The neighbors ate all my candy!!
Mine stole my newspaper! Its like a crime wave!! (Monica runs to make more candy.) Pheebs, you uh, you got a second.
Sure!
Yeah, ever since you uh, told me that story about that bike I-I couldnt stop thinking about it. I mean, everyone should have a-a first bike, so
(gasps) Oh my God Ross!!
You like it?
I love it!!
Yeah?
Ohh!! Ohh!! And I love you!
Ahh.
Not that way! But the bike brought you a lot closer!
Ah! (She hugs him.) Well uh-uh, t-take it downstairs, yknow give it a test ride.
Okay! Oh my God! My first bike! Thank you for the best present Ive ever gotten.
(stunned at the complement) Youre welcome.
(starts to leave, but stops) Oh and Chandlers about to cry.
(about to cry) Am not!
(turning a light on) Who is that?!
Dont worry, Im brave! I am brave! II am brave! (They get to the door and Monica goes to open it.) No-no-no-no!! (He stops her.) (Through the door.) Can you tell me who is there please?
Hi!
Hi. Do you know what time it is?
Its candy time! My roommate says that they taste like little drops of heaven.
Oh please! (To Chandler) Did you hear that? Little drops of heaven.
(laughs) 4:00 A.M.
So, can I get some candy?
I am sorry, but some of us have to get up early and go to work! (Monica looks at him) (To Monica) He does not know that I am not some of us.
Umm, listen I am sorry, but Ill put some out first thing in the morning.
Well okay, Ill swing by later. Do you live in this building?
Um-hmm.
(looking at Monica.) Mm! Seems like I wouldve remembered you!
Mm! Night Gar! (Monica closes the door.)
(hugging him) So did you read your evaluation yet?
No! It was marked confidential I just sent it down to Human Resources.
(worried) Okay please, youre kidding right?! I wrote that one as a joke for you!
A joke they would appreciate?
Im thinkin no.
What did you say?!
Umm, I said I thought you were a good kisser, and uh, and that I like your tiney-tiny touchie.
No, not my touchie.

Well, it gets worse. When asked if you take initiative I wrote, "Yes, he was able to unhook my bra with minimal supervision," and under Problems with Performance I wrote, "Dear God, I hope not," and then uh, then I drew a little smiley face, and then a small pornographic sketch.
Ross! That is so sweet of you to get Phoebe that bike! When I heard the story, I almost cried.
Almost cried huh? Hear that Chandler? Almost cried!
Hey, you cry every time somebody talks about Titanic!
(about to cry) Those two only had each other!
Phoebe really likes the bike huh?
Oh yeah! I saw her walkin it down the street the other day. She had uh, these flowers in the basket. It was so cute.
Yeah, I saw her this morning walkin it by the park.
Wait a minute, she was walking the bike? Both times?
Hey Pheebs?
Oh hi!
Hey! So are you enjoying the bike?
Ohh, uh-huh so much!
Pheebs you uhyou do know how to ride a bike dont you?
Of course!
Umm, can we see you ride it?
Okay. (The gang is giggles then Phoebe gets the bike out of the rack, gets on, pushes off, rolls a few feet, and falls over.) See?
See, this is why I told you never get involved with your assistant! And here is no such thing as keeping secrets when it comes to affairs. (To Chandler) Did you hear that Chandler? No such thing!
(with his mouth full) What happened? Im just eating candy.
Maybe its not as bad as I think. Yknow, maybe they didnt take it the way I meant it.
Absolutely! Yknow, because touchie can mean both ass and good worker.
Ugh, I just gotta get the thing back!
Hey Rach?
Yeah?
That sketch you mentioned? Might it have looked a little something like this? (He shows her what hes been drawing.)
Oh my God! Joey!
What is the matter with you?
Ugh!
Boy I tell ya, this little talent came in handy before I could afford porn.
Hi! Im sorry, I know its after hours but I really need candy.
Im sorry, I cant help you. See? (Points to her new sign.) Rules are rules.
Please! I have people coming from out of town today! And, I told them all about your candy!
No kidding, out of towners huh? What did you tell em?
I told em your candy is absolutely indescribable!
Some people have been saying its yknow little drops of heaven, but whatever.
Please, cant you help me out?
(watching the discussion) Hey Chandler, do we know that lady?
Maybe, isnt she the woman who lives below you and has sex really loud?
(still talking to the woman) All right, Ill do it just this once! But you cant tell anybody!
(exasperatedly) Yes! Yes! Please, just give it to me!
(after Monica gives her the candy) Thank you.
(closing the door) Its unbelievable! I-I cant believe that sign didnt work!
Yknow what would work?
Hmm?
Stop making candy!
But they like it!
You mean they like you.
Maybe.
Is that why you became a chef? So that people would like you?
Oh, you really want to talk about getting people to like you huh, funny man? (Joey laughs but stops when Chandler turns to glare at him.)
Okay, now just remember everything I taught you and youll be fine. Okay? Here we go. ReadySet
(hopping off the bike) Wait! This seat is really uncomfortable! Yeah, maybe before we start we should just get another one. Perhaps, like an airplane seator a beanbag chair!
Phoebe, you cant get out of this! Okay? You have to learn how to ride a bike!
Why? Why do I have to learn?
WellIn-in case of emergency.
What kind of an emergency?
Well let therewhat if a man comes along and puts a gun to your head and says, "You ride this bike or Ill shIll shoot you."
Okay, I would ring the bell to distract him and then I would knock the gun out of his hand with a Chinese throwing star.
Okay, Phoebe just-just get-get on the bike andHey! Ill hold you up and-and push you. Okay?
You wont let go?
No!
Swear?!
I swear!
(thinks it over) Okay.
Come on. (She gets on the bike.) All right, here we go. All right? (They start.)
All right.
All right. Feel good?
Well
All right, try pedaling.
Okay. (Does so.)
Thats it, your doing great.
Okay.
Doing great! Yes-yes-yes! Take control! Yes!
Weee!!! (Ross pushes her and lets go.)
Yes!! Yes!!! (He starts clapping and Phoebe turns around to look at him and falls off the bike.)
Oh! Oh! Oh no!! You swore!
I-I just thought you were doing so well. I
I am shocked! Shocked!! (She storms off leaving Ross to defend himself from the angry looks from onlookers.)
Its a legitimate learning technique. (Looking around and seeing the woman behind him glaring at him.) Wow!
Hey, theres uh, some people outside, askin about candy.
Well, theyre just gonna have to wait arent they? Ive only got two hands!!
Need some help?
No! You dont know the system! Therell be nobody messing with the system!
By the way, the week before your wedding you may not see a lot of me. (She glares at him and he quickly makes his way to Phoebes room.)
(seeing him) Oh, hello liar.
(entering) Look, I-Im really sorry I let go of the bike.
I couldve been killed I hope you know!
I know. I know. But, can we please try it again? Huh? I mean, you were so close Phoebe!
Well, I would love to butthe bike got stolen and the police have no suspects. (Ross just happens to have his hand on a sheet that is covering something that suspiciously looks like a bike.)
Phoebe.
What?! (Ross rings the bell.) What the hell?!
All right, yknow what? If you are not going to learn how to ride this bike then Im sorry, Im just gonna have to take it back.
What?! Why?!

Because! Because, it-it-its Itd be like you having this guitar (Points to hers) and-and never playing it. Okay, this guitar wants to be played! And-and this bike wants to be ridden and-and if you dont ride it you-youre-youre killing its spirit! (Pause) The bike is dying.
All right. If you care enough to make up that load of crap, okay.
Great! Great! (He runs to the door.) Youre making the bike very happy.
(sarcastically) Okay Ross! (Ross exits and she says quietly to the bike) Please dont die!

Okay, I think we can get the evaluation back before they see it, but were gonna have to get into Mr. Zelners office. Now, he doesnt get in until 10, so hes no problem, but his assistant, Betty, she comes in early to eat her breakfast at her desk.
Thats kinda sad.
Yeah, well Bettys kinda sad. Which is why I believe I can lure her away with these chocolates. (Holding up the box of chocolates.) Now, while I distract her, you get in the office.
Got it!
Lets roll!
Hello Rachel, you uh, got a minute?
(worried and shocked) Yeah, sure Mr. Zelner, for you anythingminute. Okay. Fine. (To Tag) Abort the plan, abort the plan. (She start to usher Tag out.)
Uh actually, Id like to speak with both of you.
Okay. Uh, well can we, can we get you anything Mr. Zelner? Maybe some chocolates? (Holds up the box.)

Umm, no. Thanks, but Ill give these to Betty. (Rachel glances at Tag to say, "See?") So I read your evaluation of Tag, or to use his full name, Tag Sweetcheeks Jones. Is something going on with you two?
(laughs) Oh my God. Can you imagine if there was?! I mean, (getting serious) what would happen exactly.
Well, Id be forced to file a report. Id have to consult with the legal department, and your future at the company would be in jeopardy.
Well
(interrupting) Uh Mr. Zelner, Im the one who filled in that evaluation.
Oh no-no-no
(interrupting again) Yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah, I thought it would be funny.
You wrote that you have a cute touchie?
(pause) Yes. I have a weird sense of humor, and Im kinda strangely proud of my butt.
Its kind of a risky joke Tag, and what is-what is this drawing I cant figure out what this is?
Youre lookin at it upside downyknow what? (Grabs the evaluation and throws it out.) It doesnt matter.

Yeah, its not like I dont have a sense of humor, huh? Hell, I even enjoy a naughty limerick now and then. But theres a time and a place, huh?! Unless you uh, have a limerick right now? (They both nod no.) No? Okay, well uh, youve (Grabs the chocolates.) got my fax number. (Exits.)
Whoa! I cant believe you did that. That was really sweet.
No, dont worry about it.
No, you couldve lost your job.
Are you kidding me?! With a cute butt like this, Id find work.
Thank you! Youre great! (They kiss.)
Yknow what?
What?
I feel great. (Rachel laughs) In fact! (Walks over to her desk, sweeps its contents onto the floor and Rachel just glares at him.) What?
I It justit took me so long to get that desk organized.
Oh, Im sorry. (He bends over to pick the stuff up.)
(looking at his butt) There it is. (They hug.)
(asking a man leaning against the wall) What is going on?
Were waiting for the candy. (Yelling at the door.) Bring out the candy!
Yeah lady! Give us candy!!
Joey!
Whats up buddy?
What are you doing?
Waiting for candy.

Get in here! (They head for the door and Chandler sees Smokes-A-Lot Lady standing next to the door and smoking, to her) Hey, and you can not smoke in here! (Takes the cigarette and takes a drag for himself.) (Exhaling in ecstasy) Merry Christmas.
(opening the door and frantically) Okay, guys! The candy is coming; I just need another 15 minutes for the chocolate to cool!
We want candy! We want candy now! (And other general commotion sounds.)

All right everybody! Just be quiet! Be quiet! Be quiet!! Pipe-pipe-pipe down! (They settle down) What is the matter with you people?! This woman was trying to do a nice thing for you. She was making candy so she could try to get to know all of you, and Ill bet that not one of you can tell me her name! Am I right?
(from earlier) Candy Lady?
No not (imitating) Candy Lady.
(stepping in and knocking the man over) Hey, if we know it can we have candy?!!
All right, yknow what? Forget it, all of you forget it! Youve ruined it! Go home! Youve ruined it! Youve ruined it!
Thats right, its all ruined! You guys ruined everything! You ruined it! (Steps into the apartment and Chandler closes the door.) (Joey struts over to the candy and starts eating it.)
(To Chandler) Thank you.
Youre welcome. (They kiss.)
Did you smoke?
No! Smokes-A-Lot Lady blew smoke directly into my mouth. Eh-uhare you okay?
Im fine now, but it was really scary there for a while. I mean, someone slipped a-a threatening note under the door.
(with his mouth full) Oh yeah, sorry about that. Mob mentality or whatever, I dont know (Grabs the note.)
I cant believe it! I did it! I rode a bike! I never thought Id be able to do that! Thank you Ross.
Oh hey, dont thank me, thank yourself. Youre the one who faced her fears and ultimately overcame them.
Dont be so corny Ross, its not an after-school special. (She rides off and the camera pans down to reveal two shiny, silver training wheels firmly attached.)
Buh-bye. (Hangs up the phone) I just got us reservations at Michelles and tickets to the Musicman to celebrate our first holiday season as a betroughed couple.
Betrothed (Corrects him)
betrothed couple.
(entering carrying a skull) Hey!
Hey!
Haaaa... (Puts the skull on the table) ... ahhhh!
Pheebs?
Huh?
Skull?
Oh, yeah, it's my mom's.
(freaking out) Oh my god!!

No, no, no. It's not! It's not my mom. It belonged to mom. Yeah, no, she used to put it out every Christmas to remind us, that even though it's Christmas, people still die. And, you can put candy in it. (She grabs the skull, pulls out a stick of licorice, and takes a bite.)
(entering) Hey!
Hey!
(Offering Ross the skull) Licorice?
(Thinking it over) Sure! (Takes one) Hey, I just found out, I get Ben for the holidays this year.
Ohh! That's great!
Are you gonna dress up as Santa?
Nope. I mean, I know Susan does every year, but I think I wanna take this year to teach him all about Hanukkah.
And maybe I could teach Ben about the Christmas skull and how people die.
You may need to use this year to teach Ben about Phoebe.
Hmm.
Hey. (He exits)
(to Monica) Did you know he was in there?
No.
How long have we been home?
About a half an hour.
Lovely!
Hey, you know what I was thinking? When we get married, are you gonna change your last name to Bing?
No.
Why not?
Bing's weird.
(entering) Oh, hey, you guys!
Hey!
Hey!
Hey. Guess what! My landlord just called and my apartment is gonna get ready soon, so I guess I'll be moving out.
Ahh, Phoebe, I'm gonna miss you!
Yes, you will be very sad. All right, well I gotta go tell Rachel the good news.
Ohh! You guys gonna be living together again?
Yeah, why not?
Well, she's just so much fun with Joey, I just assumed, she'd still be living with him.
Why do you think, she's having so much fun living with Joey?
No reason, exceptshetoldme.
Really? So she said, she didnt wanna live with me anymore?
No! No, she didn't say that. I-I-I think you should talk to Monica now.
Phoebe, don't worry about it. I'm sure she wants to live with you.
You're sure? You're absolutely sure?
Well, no. But, um, I bet she probably does.

Probably? Yeah, I don't like that word. (Chandler and Monica look surprised) Kind of what probably really means. Yeah, uh-huh. Yeah, oh, "Your mom probably won't kill herself," yknow? I'm sorry, but I'm not hanging all my hopes of Rachel and I living together on-on "Probably!" Yknow? You gotta take care of yourselves! (She starts to walk out) In this world history teaches us nothing! (Exits)
Bing doesn't seem so weird now, does it?
(entering) Hey!
Hey! Great, youre home! Guess what Phoebe got me for Christmas! (Starts drumming.)
Drums?
(yelling) No! Drums!
(to the Maitre d') Hi, could we get two burritos to go, please? (Laughs.)
I'm sorry. But not that sorry, 'cause you don't have to live with it. Um, we have a reservation under the name Chandler Bing.
Oh-kay, we'll have a table for you in about 45 minutes.
Forty-five minutes? We have tickets to the Musicman at 8:00.
I'm sorry. Christmas is a very busy time, sir.
Is this because of the burrito thing?
(pulling Chandler away from the Maitre d') You need to give him money.
Give him money? It was a joke!
No, to get a table! Places like are always shakin you down. Everybody wants to be paid off.
Right, calm down, O'Mally. I'll slip him some money.
You've got to be smooth about it.
Hey, I can be smooth. (Walks back to the Maitre d', very smoothly) Listen, we're a little bit in a hurry, so, if you can get us a table a little quicker, I'd appreciate it. (Shakes his hand)
Of course, sir.
Okay. (Walks back to Monica)
How did it go?
Had the money in the wrong hand. (Shows her his left hand with the money in it)
Wooooooo, hehehe. Hey, ahh, you don't feel like you're gonna throw up, do ya?
No.
Well, I do, so let's... (Ben and Ross sit down on the couch) So, Ben, you uh, you know what holiday is coming up, don't ya?
Christmas.
Yep, and you know what other holiday is coming up?
Christmas eve.
Yes, but also (Pauses to let Ben answer, but he doesnt.) Hanukkah! See, you're part Jewish, and-and Hanukkah is a Jewish holiday.
Santa has reindeers that can fly!
Right, um, but, on Hanukkah, Hanukkah is a celebration of a miracle. See, years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees.
(singing) Jingle bells, jingle bells...
(interrupts him) Okay, that's right, yes, but on Hanukkah, uh, we sing, uh (Sings) Dreidel, dreidel, dreidel, I made you out of clay.
(singing) Rudolph, the red-nosed reindeer...
(interrupts him again) Okay, it's not a contest.
When is Santa coming?
Well, how about this year, instead of Santa, we have fun celebrating Hanukkah?
No Santa? Was I bad?
No! Oh, no-no-no. Hey, you weren't bad, you've been very good, Ben.
Santa's mad at me.
No, hey-hey, come on, (He grabs Ben and sits him on his lap) Ben, Santa is not mad at you, okay? Hey, you're-you're his favorite little guy!
So Santa's coming?
(disappointed) Yes! Santa's coming!
It's easy! Just keep it casual! Give him a kind word, shake his hand and give him the money!
How do you know so much about this?
I don't know.
Richard used to do it, didn't he?
We'd be eating our soup right now.
Mustached bastard
(sees two people exit) Okay, those people just left, come on! Quick! Give him the money and get their table!
(walks up to the Maitre d') Excuse me...
(to the Maitre d') Good evening. (Shakes his hand)
(finds his money) Ahh-hahaha! (Turns around to give the Maitre d' his money, but he isn't there anymore)
(stopping at Phoebes entrance) Ha!
So you like the drums! That's, that's great! Yknow, I was worried, that, you know, they would maybe an unbearable living situation. All right, okay, well, apparently not! So, yay!
Hey-hey, Pheebs, check it out, we already learned a song. (To Rachel) Ready? One, two, three, four...
That's fun. (She exits disappointedly.)
Here you go.

Thank you Gunther, put it there. (He gets up, and shakes Gunther's hand. A bunch of coins fall out his hand. He sits down next to Monica.) Definitely not easier with coins. (Joey gets up and picks up the coins. Chandler thinks, Joey is just helping him to pick them up.) Thank you.
Thank you. (He gets up and puts on his jacket.) (Phoebe enters) Hey Pheebs!
Hey!
Here. (Gives her the coins) Now I only owe you $49.50.
Hey Pheebs!
Hey! (she sits down next to him)

If you wanna give Joey a Christmas present that disrupts the entire building, why not get him something a little bit more subtle, like a wrecking ball, or a vile of small pox to release in the hallway?
It's not just the drum noise. Every five minutes, Joey throws his sticks in the air, and I have to hear, "Oh my eye! Oh god, my eye!" I mean, it is so annoying.
Yes, thank you. You see, this is how normal people are supposed to react to drums.
Phoebe, you got Joey drums to annoy Rachel, so she wouldn't wanna live there anymore?
Maybe on some level.
Joey, yknow that you could just not throw the sticks up in the air.
What is Rock 'n' Roll about that?
(entering with an aquarium covered by a towel) Hey, Joey, I got you another present. (She puts it on the counter)
Oh wait, before you tell me what it is! (He plays a drum-roll) Okay, what is it?

It's atarantula! (Joey almost falls down from his drum-stool jumping up) Oh! God! Rachel, look, I'm sorry. What was I thinking giving Joey this big, gross, scary spider in such a poorly constructed cage?
What are you talking about? I love them! (Looks into the cage) Yeah, I had a tarantula when I was a kid. But it-it died, because my cat ate it. And then, then my cat died. But Joey, isn't this cool?
Is it on me? I feel, I feel like it's on me! I got, hey! (He storms into his room)
Oh, isn't that adorable? Joey is afraid of the tarantula.
(sarcastic) Ah, yeah, he's so adorable, God, he's just so much fun, Joey is the best, I'm glad you're having so much fun here. (She turns around, about to leave)
What? Wait-wait a minute, what? Phoebe, what's the matter?
Our apartment is ready.
And that makes you angry because
Because you would rather live here with Joey.
Where did you get that?
Monica and Chandler said that you were having so much fun here. And apparently no amount of drums or tarantulas is gonna change that.
Phoebe?
Hm?
Did you get all this stuff for Joey to try and drive me out of the apartment? Honey, if you wanted to do that, you might as well just gotten him a fish, you know how fish freaked me out!
(nods along) Fish!
It wouldn't have mattered anyway, Phoebe, you and I are, are gonna live together, we're roommates; that's the deal.
Yes, but I wanted you to want to live with me, but okay, if you're having so much fun over here
Oh, it's so much more fun with you.
We did have fun, didn't we?
We did!
Oh, anyway, they say, if we want, we can see it tonight.
Oh, I would love to!
Yay, okay!
Good, good, good, good, good. (She runs to the drums and gets the sticks)
Great, all right, okay, and Monica ask me to make the drumming stop.
(with the sticks in her hands) Um... (She goes to the tarantula-cage and puts the sticks into it) Done!
Hey!
Hello, Sir. You're here to return those pants?
No, these are my pants.
Oh. Okay! How can I help you?
Well, uh, do you have a Santa-outfit left?
Two days before Christmas? Sorry, man.
Okay look, do-do, you have anything Christmassy? I promised my son, and I really don't want to disappoint him, um, come on, Iuh, you gotta have something.
I'm the holiday armadillo! I'm a friend of Santa's and he sent me here to wish you (Points to Ben) a Merry Christmas!
What happened to Santa, Holiday Armadillo?
(to Monica) Santa was unavailable so close to Christmas.
Wow, come in, have a seat. You must be exhausted coming all the way fromTexas.
Texas?

That's right, Ben. I'm Santa's representative for all the southern states. And Mexico! But, Santa sent me here to give you these presents, Ben. (He tries to bend down to pick up the bag with the presents, but can't because of the costume) Maybe the Lady will help me with these presents.
Wow! Thanks!
You're welcome, Ben. Merry Christmas, ooh, and Happy Hanukkah!
Are you for Hanukkah, too? Because I'm part-Jewish.
(gasps) You are? Me, too!
Because Armadillos also wandered in the desert?
(to Monica) You wanna wander in the hall? (to Ben) Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the festival of lights?
Cool!
Yeah!
Come on Ben.
Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees...
(entering in a Santa costume) Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!
Santa! (Runs to Chandler and hugs him)
Hey! (Grunts as Ben hits him at full speed.)
What are you doing here, Santa?
Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weirdturtle-man?
I'm the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?
What?
Did you bring me any presents, Santa?

You bet I did, Ben, put it there! (He shakes Ben's hand, but the money falls out of his hands) (to Monica) Well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren't so damn small! (Realizes, that Ben is standing right there) Ho, ho, ho!
Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo, and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence, I never thought I'd say.
(to Chandler) What are you doing?
You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!
Thank you, but, but you gotta leave.
Why?
Because, I'm finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you're-youre wrecking it.
But I didn't get to shape my belly like a bowl full of jelly.
I'm sorry, Chandler but this, this is really important to me.
Fine, I'll give the suit back.
(to Chandler) Hey, you think, you can keep it another night? (She has a really teasing look on her face and keeps twirling Chandler's beard.)
Santa? Really?
Yes, is that okay?
Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?
No.
Then it's okay! (They kiss.)
Okay Ben, Santa has to go. Say good-bye!
No! Why does he have to go?
Because, if Santa and the HolidayArmadillo? (Ross nods) ...are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. Merry Christmas!
No! Why can't the Armadillo leave? I want Santa!
Fine, I-I give up. Santa, Santa can stay.
Well, I'll stay, but only because I wanna hear about Hanukkah. Ben, will you sit here with Santa and learn about Hanukkah?
Okay, Santa!
All right, it's time for the story of Hanukkah. Years and years ago, there were these people called the Maccabees.
(entering wearing a Superman costume) Merry Christmas!
Oh wow! Look at this place!
Oh, this is terrible. Oh, theyve made so many changes I cant even feel my grandmothers presence anymoreOoh! New sconces!
(yelling from another room) Oh my God!
What?
(returning) Okay, remember uh, remember how you told me that your grandmother put up that wall to make that into two bedrooms?
Yeah?
And remember how you always said you were afraid the landlord would find out and then tear it down?
Yeah?
Do you really not know where Im going with this? (Phoebe nods, "No.") It left! Its one huge room!
Oh no! (She runs to see.) (Running back, excitedly) Oh! Wow!!!
See?
Well, I guess well just have to put the wall back up.
You cant, because of the new skylight!
Theres a skylight?! (Runs to see and yells from the bedroom.) Wow!!
So what should we do? Should we start looking for a new place?
(returning slowly) Yknow Im-Im sensing that um, my grandmother would not be comfortable with that.
Oh yeah? Startin to feel her again there are we?
A little bit, yeah.
Pheebs is your grandmother maybe saying that you should live here alone?
You heard her too?! You have the gift!
Phoebe, its okay. I like living with Joey.
Are you sure?
Oh please, I hate packing, its closer to work, and we do have fun. Although, Im really gonna miss living with you.
Oh me too.

I know. (They hug.) Oh-oh, wait did you hear that-hear that? Listen, Im gettin something from your grandmother, she said that since you get to keep the one bedroom apartment you should give Rachel the purple chair?
No, I do not hear that.
and the miracle was that that little bit of oil that shouldve just lasted just one day, burned for
(answering him) Eight whole days.
Thats right, and thats why we celebrate Hanukkah today. The end.
Awesome!
Yeah?
My favorite part was when Superman flew all the Jews out of Egypt. (Glaring at Joey whos nodding.)

The Armadillo was actually not so thrilled about that part! Okay Ben, its time to light the Hanukkah candles! (Santa, Superman, Monica, Ben, and the Holiday Armadillo go over to the menorah to light the candles.)
(entering with Phoebe) Hey!
Oh.
(seeing the collection of characters.) Wow! It looks like the Easter Bunnys funeral in here.
Come on, come on, were-were-were lighting the candles!
Oh.
Oh.
Okay, I understand why Superman is here, but why is there a porcupine at the Easter Bunnys funeral?
I got it!
(yelling from the bedroom) Is it back in the cage?
Its back in cage!
Cage closed?
Joey, would you just come out here and stop being such a baby!
Ohh. Mmm.
(Comes in the front door and walks towards the kitchen.) Hi.
Hey, you have got to try this cheesecake.

Oh, yknow I'm not that much of a sweet tooth. I(Chandler puts a forkful of the cheesecake in her mouth.)Wow. My God, so creamy. Oh my God, this is the best cheesecake I have ever had. Where did you get this? (She reaches over to look at the label on the box.)
(nervously) It was at the front door. When I got home. Somebody sent it to us.
Chandler, this is not addressed to you. This is addressed to Mrs. Braverman downstairs. (Gasping) Thief.
Ino! I didn't read the box before I opened it. And you can't return a box after you've opened the box.
Why, why not?
Because it's too delicious.
Chandler, you stole this cheesecake. That is wrong.

No-no-no! It is going to be okay, because Mrs. Braverman is gonna send away for a free one and that way we all win! The only losers are the big cheesecake conglomerate, (Reading the label) Mommas Little Bakery. (Pause) I feel terrible, Im a horrible, horrible, horrible person.
(taking a bite) Oh, Im sorry what?
All right, I should get going, big day a work. Yknow Im in a coma? Today, they do this test on me and it turns out Im not brain dead.
So
Ah-ah-ah Mr. Smartie Pants, its just not my character thats not brain dead. Hey, so Pheebs, we still on for tonight?
Absolutely!
Ill see you at 8:00.
Okay. (Joey exits.)
Oh, whats at 8:00?
Oh, I have dinner plans with Joey. We get together about once a month to discuss the rest of you guys.
Wow, did not know that! May I say how lovely you look today?
Duly noted.
Thanks. (Phoebe gets up to get a refill.) (To Monica) Oh! So for tomorrow, do you want to rent a car and drive down together or what?
What are you talking about?
Cousin Frannies wedding, its tomorrow night.
You were invited?!
No.
My God, I cant believe this! I mean I knew that mom and dad were invited, but I thought that was it! I mean from the ages 7 to 9 Frannie and I were inseparable!
Well, maybe since the age of 9, Frannies made some new friends.
Well l-look okay, its probably just a mistake. Let me call Aunt Sheryl okay? Maybe you are invited and the invitation just got lost in the mail.

Yeah, well you call her and tell her that yknow when we were kids her precious little Frannie tried to undress me several times, okay? And if I hadnt have stopped her, there probably wouldnt even be a wedding to go too.
Yknow, she tried to undress me too.
I used to undress my cousin Glenn. (Monica looks at him then sushes him.)
Joseph Francis Tribbiani are you home yet?!!
Umm, I think hes still out. Whats wrong?
Well, Ill tell you Rachel Karen Green, I had plans with Joey tonight and he left me this note. (Hands it to Rachel.)
(reading the note) "Pheebs, cant make it, got a date. Talk to you later. Big Daddy." (Laughs) Big Daddy?
Oh thats a nickname we were trying out.
Hey, yknow what nickname never caught on? The Ross-A-Tron! (Monica shakes her head in disgust.)
(entering) Hey!
Oh! Heres Joseph Francis!
Oh-Wha-Ho! What are you middle naming me for?! I left you a note!
So what?! That doesnt give you the right to ditch me!
Hey, you can cancel plans with friends if there is the possibility for sex!
Phoebe hes right, that is the rule.

I dont accept this rule. When me make plans, I expect you to show up. Okay, I cant just be a way to kill time til you meet someone better! Yknow boyfriends and girlfriends come and go, but this (Motions that their friendship) is for life!
Wow! Im so sorry; I had no idea it would bother you this much.
Well, it does.
Okay, can I-can I make it up to you? Huh? Im sorry. (They hug.) How about uh, dinner tomorrow night?! Ill pay for myself!
Okay, you wore me down.
Hey Joe, while youre over there how about another beer for the Ross-A-Tron?
The RossIs that back?!! (Chandler motions no.)
Hi!
Another cheesecake came! They delivered it to the wrong address again!
So just bring it back downstairs, whats the problem?
I cant seem to say goodbye.
Are you serious?! Chandler, we ate an entire cheesecake two days ago and you want more?
Well Ive forgotten what it tastes like okay?!
It was cheesecake. It was fine. It had a buttery, crumbly, graham cracker crust, with a very rich yet light, cream cheese filling (Pause) Wow! My whole mouth just filled with saliva!
(closing the box) Yknow what? Forget it! We are just hungry! We have not had lunch! We are just light-headed! So let us go out and have lunch and forget about the cheesecake.
Yeah and well drop it off downstairs so that were not tempted.
Good idea. Where do you want to go to lunch?
Mommas Little Bakery, Chicago, Illinois. (They exit with the cheesecake.)
Awww! Mel Torme died.
Joey, that papers like a year old!
Aw! Does that mean the Sam Goodys sale is over?!
(entering) Hey.
Hey.
Hey.
So I finally heard back from Aunt Sheryl and apparently it wasnt a mistake. Ahh, theres-theres limited seating in the hall.
Limited seating?! (Screechingly) I am just one tiny person!
Well yeah, but she doesnt know that. I mean, the last time she saw you-you wouldve turned one of those little wedding chairs into kindling.
(disgusted) Limited seating! Oh, that is such a lame excuse! Thats not the reason shes not inviting me!

Oh whats the big deal?! I wasnt even invited to the ceremony, just the reception. And-and yknow what? If it makes you feel any better, Joan and I will just make an appearance and then, and then well-well leave early as a sign of protest.
Joan?
Yeah, Joan Tedeski my date. Shes an assistant professor in the Linguistics department. Tall, very beautiful, and despite what some people say, not broad backed!
Wait a minute, you got Ross Gellar and guest?! I wasnt invited and you got "and guest?!"
Uh-uh, excuse me, I do have to interrupt on Rosss behalf. I-I think the rule applies here yknow, since she has a chance to get on broad back
(interrupting) Not broad backed!
Wait a minute, yknow, youre bringing me!
What? I cant cancel on Joan!
Why not?!
BecDid you not hear me?! Shes an assistant professor in the Linguistics department, okay? Theyre wild! Why do you want to come anyway?
Because! Shes my cousin. I mean, we grew up together! Were family yknow? Well thats important to me.
Okay, all right, Ill take you. Ill go call Joan. (Does so.)
Aww thats nice. Family should be there, huh? This is her wedding, happiest day of her life.
(laughs) Well see.
Well, thank you for lunch.
What? Wait a minute, I didnt pay, I thought you paid!
So apparently we just dont pay for food anymore. (Rachel laughs then Chandler notices something.) Do you see what I see?
(gasps) Its still there! (The cheesecake they returned to Mrs. Braverman is still lying in front of her door.)
Mrs. Braverman must be out. (They move closer to it.)
She could be out of town. Maybe shell be gone for months.
By then, the cheesecake may have gone bad. We dont want her to come back to bad cheesecake.
No that could kill her.
Well, we dont want that.
No so were protecting her.
But we should take it.
But we should move quick.
Why?
Because I think I just heard her moving around in there.
Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! (Rachel grabs the cheesecake and they take off upstairs.)
(gasps) (whispering) Oh my God! Thats David!
David who?
David the scientist guy, David that I was in love with, David who went to Russia and broke my heart David!
(noticing Phoebe) Oh my God!
Oh, you say someones name enough, they turn around.
Phoebe?
David! (He kisses her cheek) What-what are you doing here? Arent you supposed to be in Russia?
Yeah, Im just, Im just in town for a conference. Umm, God you look phenomenal!
Well Yeah. You look great too. Did you get a haircut?
Yeah. Well I-I got like thirty of them.
Yeah.
Umm, look I-I-I got a confession to make
Uh-huh.

Uh, I-I-I was hoping to run into you here. I didnt know whether I should call or not, yknow I-I was only in town for a few days. And yknow, I didnt want to intrude on your life or-or anything like that, but I-I really wanted to see you andbut I didnt know if you wanted to see me.
Well, of course I would want to see you. II think about you all the time.
Really? Because I think about you all the time.
Really?
I mean, theres a statue in Minsk
Uh-huh.
That reminds me of you so much, I mean umm, it-its actually of Lenin. But, yknow at certain angles
Yeah.
Umm, anywayDo you want to have dinner tonight?
(excited) Yes! Oh no!
(disappointed) Oh. Uh, what?
I cant. I cant believe I have plans, I cant. Can you do it tomorrow night though?
Uh no, I have to go in a few hours. I have to be on the red-eye. Well listen, yknow, next time youre in Minsk umm
Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?
Uh-huh. (They go over and talk.)
What are you doing?
Well, I have plans with Joey tonight.
So! Hell understand!

No he wont. And thats not even the point! Monica, I made a whole speech about you do not cancel plans with friends! And now yknow what? Just because, potentially, the love of my life comes back from Russia just for one night, I-I should change my beliefs?! I should change beliefs! No! No! No, if I dont have my principles, I dont have anything!
God, you are so strong.
Or! I should rush through dinner with Joey and I can meet David at 9:00!
(taking a bite) Oh my God! That is so good!
Im full, and yet I know if I stop eating this, Ill regret it.
(entering) Hey!
Hey!
(seeing what theyre doing) What do you got there?
Oh its umm, its tofu cake. Do you want some? (He makes a disgusted noise and heads for his room, Chandler follows him in.)
What are you doing tonight?
Huh? Uh (He starts taking off his pants.)
Dude! Dude! (Motions that Joey should pull up his pants.)
Oh! (Pulls up his pants.) Sorry. Uh, Ive got those plans with Phoebe, why?
Oh really? Uh, Monica said she had a date at 9:00.
What?! Tonight?!
Thats what Monica said.
After she gave me that big speech?! She goes and makes a date with a guy on the same night she has plans with me? I think shes trying to pull a fast one on Big Daddy!
Oh here, I think this is us. (Reading the name cards.) Yeah.
Limited seating my ass. Lets see who made the cut. (To the couple sitting to her right.) Hi!
Hi!
Im Monica Gellar. Who do you know the bride and groom?
Oh, I used to work with Frannie.
Used to work with her. Used to! Im a relative and I didnt get invited! A blood relative! Blood!!
(To Monica) Stop saying, "Blood" to strangers.
(to the couple on her left) So, how about you huh? How do you know the happy couple?
We went to college with both of them and now we live next door.
Okay, youre fine.
Hey!
Hey!
Are you guys ready?
Yes! I will have the green salad, umm the house salad, and waters fine.
Okay.
Okay.
(To Joey) And for you sir?
Yeah, this slow roasted salmon, just how slow are we talkin here?
Its uh, its already been roasted.
Ohh, then no. Maybe I should hear those specials again.
Oh Joey, weve heard the specials three times! Okay? Theres prime rib, mahi mahi, and a very special lobster ravioli. (She grabs his menu and hands it to the waiter.)
Actually were out of the lobster ravioli. (Putting Joeys menu under his arm.)
Oh well, that changes everything! (Grabs his menu and starts looking at it again. The waiter leaves.) Yknow what Pheebs?
Huh?
You were right before. I mean, friends are so important.
(checking her watch) Yeah, Im very wise. I know.
Yknow-yknow what I really want?
What?
Is to have a long, long talk. Yknow? Get Joey out on the open road and really open him up.
(returning) Any progress?
Yes! I will have the lobster ravioli.
God Joey, this is taking forever!
Whats the rush? What?
W-wI justits thatI haveyknow I have-I have an appointment. And its very important.
Whoa-whoa, what is it?
Well Its a date.
A date?! No, no Pheebs you-you must be mistaken, because I know you wouldnt schedule a date on the same night you have plans with a friend!
Come on Joey, dont make me feel badly about this.
No, Im gonna!! Thats right! Yeah, you made me feel really guilty about goin out with that girl! Like-like-like I did something terrible to you! And now Pheebs, youre doing the same thing!
ThatIts not the same thing! This is totally different! This is with David! Remember David, the scientist guy? Okay, hes very special to me.
Okay, well my girl from the other night was special. She was a scientist too!
She was?
Well, she graduated from high school!
Okay, whatever. Yknow what? I dont have time have time to convince you because hes only here for four hours, and Im gonna go see him! (Gets up and leaves.)
Fine!
Yeah!
Fine!
Yeah! (She exits.)
(to the waiter) What are you still doin here?! I told you, lobster ravioli!
Hey!
Hey! Oh, I was just about to leave. I-I-I-I didnt think you were coming.
Oh, I wouldnt miss this.
Well, Im very glad youre here. (Kisses her hand.)
Oh, youre such a gentleman. (Grabs his arm.) Come on! Were going to my place! (Drags him off to her place.)
Are you eating the cheesecake without me?!
(with a mouthful) Mm-mmm. (Nods no.)
I will give you a hundred dollars to whistle right now. (She tries to whistle and blows little chunks of cheesecake out of her mouth.) How can you eat the cheesecake without me?!

Oh, what are you going to do?! Are you gonna go run tell Monica?! Are you gonna tell Joey?! No! Because then you will have to tell them what we did! We are desert stealers! We are living outside the law!
Yknow what? I dont trust you with this cake anymore! And I got it first, and Im takin it back! (Grabs the cheesecake and heads for his apartment.)
What?! What?!
Oh yes!
Wait a minute!
Oh yes!
Oh no-no-no-no-no, no you dont!
Oh yes! Oh yes!
You think I trust you with it?! No! Were gonna split it! You take half and I take half!
Well thats not fair, youve already had some!
What? Oh, well then yknow what? I think Monica would be very interested to know that you called her cheesecake dry and mealy.
What do we use to split it?
Okay! (Grabs a knife and cuts it in half.) All right, pick a half.
(examining the cake) Okay well, this side looks bigger. Uh Theres more crust on this side. Yknow? So, maybe if I measured
Oh for God sake just pick a piece!
All right, Ill pick that one. (Points.)

Thats also the smaller piece. (Puts the piece onto a plate.) Okay, there you go. Enjoy your half my friend, but that is it. No sharing. No switching, and dont come crying to me if you eat your piece to fast. (As shes saying that she is backing out the door, when she finishes she turns around to return to her place, stumbles and drops the cheesecake on the floor.) Oh!!!!
(gloatingly and holding his piece) Ohhh!
Okay, you gotta give me some of your piece.

Oh-ho-ho-ho-no! No! No switching! No sharing, and dont come crying to me! Ha-ha-ha! I may just sit here and have my cake all day! Just sit here in the hallway and eat my (Rachel knocks the plate from his hand and it falls on the floor. That process leaves just the forkful Chandler has, Rachel starts to go after that little bit and Chandler retreats into his apartment.)
Oh, hey Aunt Millie.
Isnt it a beautiful wedding?!

Yes, yes it is. Its uh (Aunt Millie uses this opportunity to grab Ross and kiss him on the lips. After she leaves Ross quickly wipes his mouth with a napkin.) Every time on the lips! Why?! Why on lips?!
Heres Frannie. Hmm, wont she be happy to see me? (Starts to get up and great Frannie.)
Now wait a minute, you be nice! All right? I didnt bring you here so you can ambush her.
Frannie was the one who found your Playboys and showed them to mom.
That bitch! (He gets up and they go over to ambush Frannie. Monica taps on Frannies shoulder.)
(turning around) Monica! What
Am I doing here? Why? Surprised to see me? Ross brought me. How do you like that?!
(to Frannie) Hi Frannie, congratulations.
You invite my brother, you invite my whole family, and not me?! Why?! WhatWhy wouldnt you want me at your wedding? What could I have possibly done?! (Frannies husband walks up.) Stuart!
I believe you know my husband.
So its really a question of who could you have possibly done.
Oh, I hate this but I-I-I have to go. I-I cant miss my flight.
Are you sure? Ill bet theres another flight to Minsk in like
July. Umm, (He speaks Russian.)
Thats really beautiful. What does it mean?
Please, clean my beakers. I dont get out of the lab much.
Thats good. I got to admit, I thought it was something else.
Yeah, I Well I really actually wanted to say umm, that, but um, I figured I probably shouldnt because yknow, Ihave to leave.
Youre right! Youre right. Dont say it.
I-I do though.
I do too. (They kiss.)
Bye Phoebe. (He gets in and the cab drives off. Joey walks up and witnesses that event.)
(seeing him) Okay, nows not the time Joey. All right? You can yell at me tomorrow.

No! No! No Pheebs, Im not gonna yell at you. I just yknow, started thinking about you and David and Iremember how bummed you were the first time he left. And I just Oh Pheebs, come here. (He hugs her.) Are you okay?
No Im not okay. The only guy Ive ever been crazy about has gone to Minsk and I may neverI may never see him again. (Crying.)
Hey, yknow you could always visit him.
Oh right, like theyre gonna let me have a passport.
Anything I can do? Whatever you need.
WellButNow, if-if you can achieve positronic distillation of sub-atomic particles yknow before he does, then he can come back. (They hug again.)
I can give it a shot.
Oh! Yay! Look! Theres a piece that doesnt have floor on it!
Stick to your side!
Hey, come on now!
(pulls out a fork) All right, what are we havin? (Starts digging in.)
Oh wait I forgot my wrap.
What? Oh, okay. Wait here. (Goes to get it, but before he gets there Aunt Millie sits down on it forcing him to pull it out from behind her which gets her attention.)
Hi sweetie! Are you leaving?
Well
Give us a kiss. Come on! Come on!
Why?! Why on the lips?! (He wipes his mouth on Monicas wrap and walks off, leaving Aunt Millie stunned.)
(looking up) Ross, whens this comet thing start?
Well, technically it seven billion years ago (Well, technically youd be able to see it for days, well nights; that is if you could see it with all of the bright lights of New York.)
(groaning) Oh no! Oh no! (They all start to get up a leave.)

Okay! Okay! Fine, Ill stop! No teaching, okay? Well just watch the pretty light streaking across the sky. (Comets dont streak across the sky, meteors do.) Okay? Whos official name is Bapstein-King.
Okay! Okay! (They start to leave again.)
(looking up) There it is! Oh, look at that! Isnt Mother Nature amazing?
(looking up with her) Thats a plane!
Well, all right. 1700 bags of peanuts flying that high, thats pretty amazing too.
Hey, I wonder if you can see my apartment from up here.
No. No, you cant.
What?
Oh I dont-I dont know.
Man, look at all those stars! (Yeah, you can see what? Five of them from the city?) Infinite space. It really, really makes you wonder, doesnt it?
(looking through his binoculars at a nearby building) Yknow what else makes you wonder?
Huh?
Check out the rack on this chick! (Turns around to point it out to Ross and finds that Ross is glaring at him. So he quickly puts his binoculars to his eyes and starts looking for the comet.)

Okay, weve been out here for two hours and we havent seen any stupid comets. Can we go now? I mean, Chandlers getting chilly. (She walks over to where Chandler is bundled up in a big coat and shivering.)
(with a quivering voice) No, Im not!
Then why are you wearing Monicas jacket?
Because its flattering! (Shivers harder) Come on Monica! Come on Monica! (He goes inside.)
Yeah actually, I think were gonna take off too. We rented a movie.
Oh! I wont say, no to a movie!
Uh Pheebs, we just actually kinda wanted to be alone.
Shh! Get me out of here.
Oh. (They leave, leaving just Joey and Ross.)
(whispering) Ross!
What?
Come here, check this out!
What? Is it the comet? (Runs over to where Joeys standing.)
No! No-no. Look, theres a bug stuck in tar right here. (Bends down to get a closer look.)
Joey comeI cant believeI bring you here to see the Bapstein-King comet, one of natures most spectacular phenomenon, and all you care about are bugs stuck in tar and-and some woman!
(standing up) Yknow, theres two women dude.
Show me where?
Right-right up here. (Starts looking at them through a piece of pipe.)
(noticing the pipe and looking at the door) Joey wheres the pipe that was holding the door open?
(annoyed) I dont know! (Goes back to looking through the pipe.) (Pause) Yeah, I do.
Joey!
What?! All rightHey! Dont look at me! Youre the one who wanted to come up and look for some stupid Burger King comet!
Its called the Bapstein-King comet, okay? (Joey starts to groan.) Hey! Hey! Bapstein was a very well respected astronomer!
(covering his ears and yelling) Oh no! No! No! (He starts banging on the door.)
(whispering) Monica!
Shes sleeping.
I know, just quick-quick question, quick question. Which one was Deep Impact and which one was Armageddon?
Deep Impact was the one with Robert Duval, Armageddon is whats going to happen to you if you wake me up.

Sorry, I justcant sleep. Ooh! (Turns on the light and Monica groans.) Where is that book that you are reading with the two women who were ice-skating and wearing, wearing those hats with the flowers on it? Because every time I look at that cover Im like(Fake snores.)
It is in the living room where there is also a light! And no one will kick you in the shin.
What?! (Monica kicks him in the shin.) Ow! (He gets out of bed and heads into the living room.)

(crossing her fingers and closing her eyes) Please dont be a space ship. Please dont be a space ship. (She turns on the light and looks around and finds that its the smoke detector thats beeping.) Oh thank God! (She moves a chair over and starts to investigate how to make the beeping turn off, in frustration she yanks the thing off of the wall. She sets it down and heads for bed, just as she gets there it beeps again. She opens the cover and removes the battery, but it still beeps.) How could you be beeping?! I just disconnected you! I took out your battery! How can
Dont interrupt me!!
Rachel!! Monica!!
Come on!
I cant believe this!!
All right well, yknowI guess we know what we have to do to get down.
(standing at the edge of the roof) Yeah, I guess we dont have a choice. (Screaming to the street) Help us! Please help us! Were stuck up on the roof and we cant get down!!!
Ross. I was thinking we could just go down the fire escape. (Points it out.)
(To Joey) I know, I wasnt finished. (Joey motions him to finish.) (Yelling at the street) But dont worry! Were gonna go down the fire escape!!
Shhhhhhhhh!!! (Monica enters) Im sorry, I thought maybe Id make some warm milk and it would help me sleep.
With a wok? (Chandlers holding a wok.) I thought you were going to read my boring book to put you asleep.
It got interesting! Damn you Oprah!
Here, let me make the milk, Im up anyway.
Hey, yknow what we can do? Yknow, now that we are up? We can just like talk to each other all night long, yknow like we did when we were first going out. Itd be fun!
Okay that does sound like fun.
Okay, so how bummed were you when the second sister died huh?
The second sister dies?!
(Pause) No. No, I-I was, I was talking about the book I was reading.
The second sister dies in Archie and Jughead Double Digest?
Thats correct.
You wanna go in the bedroom? Its a little more comfortable.
Sure.
Okay. (They start to head for the bedroom) Oh wait! Umm, did you send those contracts to Milan?
If this is your idea of sexy talk? (Shakes his head that its not working.)
No seriously, yknow the contracts I gave you, did you overnight them?
What contracts?
Okay please tell me that this is just one of your jokes that you do that I dont get.
Like what?
Yknow, like the thing when you put the phone in your pants? (He starts laughing.) Tag! Im serious! This isnt funny! Those contracts absolutely had to go out today!
Rach, Im sorry, but you didnt give me any contracts!
Yes I did! And I put a little Post-It on it that said, "Must go out today," and underlined today three times and, and then I put a little heart in the corner because I didnt want to seem to bossy.
Im telling you, you never gave them to me.
Yknow what Tag, if we went down to the office you would see those contracts sitting on your desk.
No, I would see you looking embarrassed because they are not on my desk!
Or maybe you would see me looking embarrassed because you are talking on the phone with your crotch!
You wanna go down to the office right now?
No! Come on its late, were not gonna go down to the office.
Okay I understand. (Sits down.) I wouldnt want to be proved wrong either.
Okay get your coat! (They get their coats and start to leave. Rachel suddenly stops and sticks the hand up the back of her shirt.) Oh! When did you unhook this? (Her bra.) Nice work!
All right, it wont go down any further. Its stuck.

Ugh. Well, were just gonna have to jump. (Joey looks at him.) Yeah. Now, were gonna have to make sure to land to the right of that patch of ice, okay? Not hit the dumpster on the other side and uh, and try to avoid that-that weird brownish red stuff in the middle. So, when you get down thereyou go up to the roof and you let me in.
Oh whoa-whoa wait a minute! I have to do it?!
Yeah! Oh yeah, youll be fine! It-itll be uh, just like bungy jumping. Yknow? But instead of bouncing back up you-you wont.
What if I smack my head on the concrete?
Well, Im gonna lie to you Joey, its a possibility.
(looks at the ground and at Ross) I dont know Ross! I-I tell you what, lets flip to see who does it, okay? You-you call it in the air, all right?
Oh, all right. (Joey flips the coin.) Tails! (The coin bounces off of the landing above them and falls to the ground.) Can you-can you see what it is?
No.
Okay. Well, you be careful.
What? No! No Ross! No-no! Stop! Im not jumping! Okay, look I have an audition tomorrow and I cant go if I break my leg.
Well Im jumping! I have a son! Okay? He wont have a father if-if I die!
Well all right so, it looks like were even!

Okay. So, this wire is connected to this wire which plugs into here. (She points at each as she says it.) Okay so, to get the beeping to stop all I have to do (She picks up a shoe and proceeds to pummel the smoke detector. She then gets up and heads to bed, stops, quickly turns around, and is satisfied that the beeping has stopped.) Well done, Pheebs. (She resumes her trek to bed, but is stopped at the entrance to the hallway by the now steady and extremely loud tone emanating from the smoke detector.) (Yelling.) What do you want from me?!!!!!!!
Okay, heres your milk. What do you want to talk about? (She sees that Chandler has fallen asleep and slams the door loudly to wake him up.)
(startled) What? What? What?
Ohh! Ohhhh! Were you sleeping sweetie? Im sorry. Here. (Hands the mug of milk to him.)
Okay! Feel free to look, but Im telling you those contracts are not on this desk.

Oh how can you possibly know? Look at this mess, Tag! I mean, this is what Im talking about! You have to be organized! Youve got newspapers! Youve got magazines! You gotOhh! (Finds a picture.) And who is this chippy? A little young for you Tag, but whatever.
Its my sister.
Okay, very cute braces. Anyway yknow what, the point is Tag, start looking because you are going to find those contracts on your desk. (She goes into her office.)
So when do you imagine you gave them to me? In the morning or in the afternoon?

In the afternoon. Mr. Zelner came into my office after lunch. He put them on my desk, and then I put a Post-It on it (Looks down onto her desk and finds the folder with the Post-It on it that contains the contracts she imagined she gave Tag) that said, "Must go out today." So you just keep looking in there! All right?
Its not here.
Puzzler. A bit of a puzzle. Why dont you um, check the copy room, maybe you left the contracts in there?
How could I have left them in the copy room?
I dont know Tag! How can your genitals make phone calls? Okay? Its not a perfect world! Just go please.
Fine.
Thank you. (He leaves and she proceeds to plant the folder in his bottom drawer. She then picks up the phone and holds it to her breasts.) Hello? (Hangs up the phone.) I still dont get it.
Are you still awake?
Yeah! You?
You do know that was me who just said that right? (He doesnt respond and she turns on the light, waking him.) Hey. As long as were both up
(intrigued) Yeah? (Monica nods yes.) I hope youre not thinking about cleaning the living room.
Man, Im starving! What the hell was I thinking at dinner?! "Do you want soup or salad?" Both! Always order both!
(looking in the window behind them) Yknow, yknow Im lookin and I dont think anyones home here. I say we just break the window, crawl through, and-and yknow explain later.
Yeah? Really? No ones home?

I dont think so. Hello? (Knocks on the glass, which angers the big, large, angry dog behind the glass and causes them to jump to the other side of the landing.) When you get in there (Joey nods his disapproval.)
Okay, this is where you and I part ways. (She drops the blanket into the chute.) Noisy bitch!
What?! What are you doing?!
Do you know what just happened?
Yeah. We-we had sex and then we fell asleep.
No. We were in the middle of sexand you fell asleep.
Nooo! No, thats not true. No, best time ever! Yeah, you rocked me world! (She turns out the light to go back to sleep.)
(turning the light back on) Monica?
What?!
I was giving you some of my best moves, and you missed it. So please wake up so we can do it right!
Okay. Okay, Im ready. Come on big fella!
Okay.
Give me the good stuff.

Yeah! (Monica falls asleep) No! No! No! Dont fall asleep! Okay, I am going to make you some coffee. (Monica doesnt move as he gets out of bed and as hes heading for the door.) And I probably wont spill coffee grounds all over the kitchen floor.
Okay, Im up! Im up!
Hi! I got you some coffee. To, uh (She looks for a place to set it on his messy desk and he clears a spot for her to set it down.) fair enough. So! Do you got anything for me?
Still no luck.
Oh my God! Did you check your entire desk! Did you check all the drawers!
Do you want me to check again?

Well yeah, I wish that you would. (He opens the top drawer.) Well, no its not in there! (Closes it.) How about that drawer? (She points to the bottom one and he opens it. She doesnt see the folder she planted and bends over to check.)
Well, its not out here. Is there any chance it could be in your office?
(thinks) Yknow, I dont-I dont know. Let me, let me check. (As she heads for her office, she stops glances over her should at Tag, looks into her office, and finds the folder on her desk.)
(smirking) Any luck?
Can I see you in my office for a minute?

(entering) Yeah? (She holds up the folder) You found them!! (Rachel is not amused, because shes still going to try to blame him for her mistake like every good boss.) Yknow what? Im not even going to gloat. Im just really relived this whole thing is over.
You put these on my desk!
I did not!
Oh really? So youre saying they just slid out of your bottom drawer, crawled across the floor, then jumped on to my desk?! (I think Dogbert should have a line here.)
How did you know they were in my bottom drawer?
(pause as she realizes her lame attempt to shift the blame has failed) I am so hot for you right now.
Oh my God! How did you get back here?!
(scared) Fire alarm? (She opens the door to reveal a fireman holding the blanket with the smoke detector.) Oh! Hi, officerfireman, can-can I help you?
We found your fire alarm in the trash chute.
Thats not mine.
Yes it is.
How do you know?
The next time you want to dump a fire alarm in a trash chute, dont wrap it in a blanket that says, "Property of Phoebe Buffay not Monica."
Okay do youOkay, do you have a search warrant? Because the last time I checked this was still America!
Please reattach this, its against the law to disconnect them.
Fine! (She takes the blanket.) But please God; tell me how to stop them from going off!
Theres a reset button under the plastic cover.

Theres a reset button?! Ugh, thank you! Thank you! (He exits and she goes to shut it off.) Theres a reset button! My God! Why didnt I see that!
